metadata.name: PowerShell Profile Modification
metadata.comment: Detects the creation or modification of a powershell profile which could indicate suspicious activity as the profile can be used as a mean of persistence

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('3') AND (endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\microsoft.powershell_profile.ps1')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\powershell\\profile.ps1')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\program files\\powershell\\7-preview\\profile.ps1')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\program files\\powershell\\7\\profile.ps1')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\windows\\system32\\windowspowershell\\v1.0\\profile.ps1')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\windowspowershell\\profile.ps1'))))

output.summary: Detects the creation or modification of a powershell profile which could indicate suspicious activity as the profile can be used as a mean of persistence

metadata.objective: False positive: System administrator creating Powershell profile manually References: https://www.welivesecurity.com/2019/05/29/turla-powershell-usage/, https://persistence-info.github.io/Data/powershellprofile.html
